column2: Chicago's favorite and for a good reason. The deep dish pizza sets the standard for Chicago style. I happen to prefer a thin crust
column3: and it turns out that they also do that very well. As a bonus
column4: our entire family likes their sweet vinaigrette salad dressing (I even found a way to buy it online). Note that since every pizza is made from scratch
column5: the wait at one of their restaurants can be long. We usually call ahead and do carry-out
column6: which turns out to transport very well.
